title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5007.3 - Refunds at retirement
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5007.3 - Refunds at retirement

State Regulations
(a) A
member may withdraw the accumulated contributions credited to his or her
individual account in the annuity savings fund by filing an application for
withdrawal of contributions no earlier than the date the member files an
application for disability, service, or deferred retirement and no later than
the date preceding the effective date of retirement; provided, however, that no
refund of contributions made pursuant to this section shall be paid to the
member until after the member is actually retired. Such application may not be
made any later than the last date for the selection, change or withdrawal of an
option selection. (b) Where a member
has a current outstanding loan and applies for a withdrawal of contributions at
retirement, such loan shall become due and payable. The amount of the loan
still outstanding, including interest and insurance, shall be deemed to have
been refunded to the member. In such case, after retirement the member shall be
entitled to receive the net amount of his/her accumulated contributions, less
the outstanding loan balance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5007.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
